<RESUME_START>
CONSTRUCTION AND DESIGN PROJECT MANAGER

SUMMARY

Seasoned Design and Construction Project Manager with more than 13 years' experience in managing multimillion
projects in the US and abroad. Expertise in coordinating and overseeing all aspects of design and construction, from
conceptualization to completion, while providing continuous status reports to business owners and investors. Proven
track record of achieving construction goals and consistently completing projects on time and budget. Fluency in
English and Italian with working knowledge of Spanish and French. Seeking to leverage success and experience to take
next career step in a challenging project management position with a respected institution in Connecticut.

SKILLS

Sage Timberline Software, Compeat, QuickBooks, Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Access)

EXPERIENCE

Construction and Design Project Manager

10/2002 to Current
Company Name
City ,
State
Oversee all facets of project management for several multimillion-dollar restaurant and residential projects in
New York City and London, including contract negotiations and administration, project estimation, material
purchasing, budget management, and site management; managed design and construction for 10 projects to
date. Coordinate with owner and investors during pre-construction phase to develop requirements, scopes of work, and
budgets; execute and manage budget and schedules from conception to completion. Organize trades, procure source materials, and liaise between owner, principal architect, designers, engineers,
subcontractors, and vendors.
Partner with architects to solicit bids for construction and design, assess bids, and award contracts.
Manage selection and hiring of design and construction subcontractors, and work with both teams to achieve
milestones on time and on budget. Document observations and photograph ongoing design and construction work, produce field reports, and
regularly communicate project status to internal partners weekly. Investigate issues and expedite resolution to maintain timelines and budgets; develop strategies to prevent
recurrence of issues. Research and commission artisans to build site specific and custom objects for interior and exterior design and
d√©cor. Source and purchase materials from international vendors, and purchase and coordinate material shipments from
vendors to construction sites. Ensure compliance with requisite regulations, including federal, state, and local building codes and safety
guidelines.
Past experience includes Education Program Coordinator at Solomon R.
Guggenheim Museum, Office
Manager at Cranmer Art Conservation, Inc., and Assistant Program Manager at Trinity College.

EDUCATION AND TRAINING

Bachelor of Arts :

The University of Vermont

Sourcing and Procurement

SKILLS

architect, Art, budget management, Budget Development and Management, budgets, budget, building codes, Contract Negotiations, contracts, Design and Construction, hiring, materials, Access, Excel, Microsoft Office Suite, Outlook, PowerPoint, Word, Office
Manager, Procurement, Project Management, Proposal, purchasing, QuickBooks, Research, safety, Sage, Solomon, Timberline

<JD_START>
Job Title: Sr Construction Project Manager - Laboratory (R+D) project

Location: Newark, NJ

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Design, Management, Project Management

Description:
Our client is a well known global company offering Design, Strategy, and Construction services for a variety of clients representing diverse industries like Education, Life Sciences, and Consumer Goods.
They have grown to 45+ offices across 20+ countries thanks to strong client partnerships cultivated by engaged and motivated employees. The company's continued focus on career development, well-being, and recognition/awards are a few reasons tenured employees highlight as reasons they have stuck around so long.
The Sr PM will be joining a well established team yet play an integral part in the leadership of a key project while aiding in the growth of their Life Sciences division.
ResponsibilitiesCollaborate with the Preconstruction team on preparation of the budget and scheduleParticipate in all Bidding and Contracting ProceduresManage subcontractor and bid processManage contract descoping and establishing scope of work for all tradesWork with subcontractors and vendors to enhance the value of construction while identifying opportunities to reduce costsWork with contractors to develop and implement a mobilization plan prior to the arrival of labor and materials on the jobsiteWork with contractors to establish and maintain a safe working environment on the jobsiteEstablish project controlsKeep Project Director apprised of the status of the budget and schedule in a timely mannerMaintain project recordsSchedule and observe all inspections, tests, commissioning, validating, and certification procedures
ExperienceMinimum 10 years of prior experience managing the construction of laboratories including R&D or process development in the NY/NJ areaFamiliar with construction Accounting principles, job cost controls, and management systems in addition to maintaining detailed Project Controls and recordsExperience constructing clean environmentsStrong knowledge of commissioning and validation of Lab facilitiesKnowledge of isolating and protecting areas from new construction activitiesExperience with GMP contracts and lump sum contractsAbility to work independently while maintaining strong communication with leadership teamsHighly collaborative with a dedicated commitment to providing superior client serviceDemonstrated ability to manage team and project meetings
 OfferCompetitive base salary from $200k to $240k+Strong performance bonuses401k w/ company match, Health BenefitsContinued growth and development opportunitiesFlexible work environment

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
